Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and decided to bowl first. Rohit Sharma mentioned the dew factor could affect the bowlers, making batting second advantageous.
Suryakumar Yadav made his ODI World Cup debut as a replacement for the injured Hardik Pandya. Mohammed Shami replaced Shardul Thakur in the Indian starting lineup.
Sunil Gavaskar's pitch assessment noted the pitch was designed for batters with small grass coverage, and pace bowlers might get purchase from the new ball with dew under lights.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India and New Zealand have faced each other in 116 ODIs, with India leading 58-50. New Zealand has had more World Cup success, winning five matches to India's three. The top two teams in the points chart have yet to lose a match, with New Zealand having a superior net run rate of +1.923 compared to India's +1.659.
